4_1BFTNXtYQDMCurqyg45KLmsV6oJD7bQSsH.body:
> [newuser123](#comment_3_1PCPuVtFv8apVpXYbc46wHugNhFUVQ6KCv): I agree with 'bon' if you don't like a site/content don't visit it and delete it from your hard-disk.
> Filtering system of any kind can easily be subverted from it's original purpose as has happened many times before.But if there's not filtering system and users are strictly against it then it becomes that much harder to censor any content.
> Plus, you're wrong, no one can abuse a non-censorship policy..... by definition.The word 'abuse' comes into play only after some form of censorship has been established.Also as far as I am concerned 'child porn','totalitarian dictatorships','communists',etc the usual 'evil' stuff are just Trojan-horses used to gain a foothold for censoring content and once a foothold is gained it's just a matter of time until only the limited-content approved by pro-censorship types are allowed.So I'm in favor of no censorship at all, including the above mentioned 'usual evils'.

You took the words right out of my mouth. You can't make exceptions to "zero censorship" or it isn't "zero" anymore. 

Once something is censored, anything else can also be censored. When anything can be censored, it's only a matter of time before everything is for one reason or another.
